did.unittitle: University of Kentucky. School of Music Concert Recordings and Programs
did.abstract: The University of Kentucky. School of Music Concert Recordings and Programs (dated 1932-2022; 69.1 cubic feet, 150 boxes and 244 Gigabytes, 20 files in University Archives and 4000 items in Fine Arts Library) comprise programs and audio recordings that document University of Kentucky School of Music faculty, student and guest instrumental and vocal recitals and ensemble concerts.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to researchers by appointment.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is arranged by format into three series: University of Kentucky Fine Arts Library School of Music Concert Recordings and Programs (FA-SOM); University of Kentucky Libraries University Archives School of Music Concert Recordings (2007ua016 [old 1991ua023/86av01]); and University of Kentucky Libraries University Archives School of Music Concert Programs (2012ua051)

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: [Historical information about the University of Kentucky School of Music.]

Music performances by faculty are considered the research equivalent of publishing books and papers by faculty in other disciplines. The recitals of applied faculty members are crucial to their development and promotion. Thus, there is a very busy schedule of faculty recitals each semester, with performances both on and off campus. Student solo recitals in either the junior or senior year (or in the case of applied students in both years) are required. Most of these are performed, as are the faculty recitals, in the Recital Hall of the Singletary Center for the Arts. The Concert Hall in the Singletary Center accommodates all of the large ensemble concerts.

The School of Music concert recordings held in the University Archives were received between 1986 and 1991. Since the early 1990s, concert recordings have been held in the Fine Arts Library. The School of Music concert programs held in the University Archives were primarily received in 2012 and non-recital programs continue to be transferred to the University Archives. School of Music recital programs are held in the Fine Arts Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Accession # : [identification of item], Title of Collection, date, University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The University of Kentucky. School of Music Concert Recordings and Programs (dated 1932-2021 May; 69.1 cubic feet, 150 boxes and 244 Gigabytes, 20 files in University Archives and 4000 items in Fine Arts Library) comprise programs and audio recordings that document University of Kentucky School of Music faculty, student and guest instrumental and vocal recitals and ensemble concerts. The ensemble concerts include chamber music, large instrumental ensembles including full orchestra, choirs and other vocal ensembles, and opera performances. The solo instruments recorded include piano, violin, 'cello, organ, harp, guitar, flute, clarinet, oboe, bassoon, trumpet, trombone, and tuba. The formats for the audio recordings include reel-to-reel, audio cassette, digital audio tape (DAT), and compact disk (CD). The formats for the programs include paper and portable document format (PDF). This collection guide provides access to the combined collection of recordings and programs held in two locations, the Fine Arts Library and the University Archives.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the University of Kentucky. The University of Kentucky holds the copyright for materials created in the course of business by University of Kentucky employees. Copyright for all other materials has not been assigned to the University of Kentucky. For information about permission to reproduce or publish, please contact the Special Collections Research Center.
